page.title: 04 TUNSTEAD QUARRY TRANSPORT
page.content: Transport is very important at the quarry.There are many different sorts of vehicles there.This includes transport inside and outside of the quarry.Inside the quarry,when the rock has been quarried,a vehicle called a {shovel}picks up the limestone and puts it into a {dumper {truck.}A dumpertruck is 20ft in length, 15ft in height and can carry a load of 50 tons at a time. A dumper carries the stone to the {crusher.}After the stone has gone through all the process,it goes to a special loading place on the { {railway line,}which runs up the side of the quarry.Before the railway line was around,horse drawn carts distributed the rock to its destination.Now,{lorries}take the stone to its destination.
